title: Divergence emerges between human traders and computer-driven investors
summary: There’s a striking divergence in the stock market between human traders and computer-driven investors. Computer-guided traders are currently more bullish than human counterparts, a gap not seen since early 2020.
fullContent: There’s a striking divergence in the stock market between human traders and computer-driven investors. Computer-guided traders are currently more bullish than human counterparts, a gap not seen since early 2020. This difference stems from their approaches—quants rely on momentum and volatility signals, while discretionary managers focus on economic and earnings trends, leading to contrasting market views.

summary: Energy groups are refocusing on exploration in anticipation of the world remaining hooked on fossil fuels for decades.

title: BlackRock and Vanguard lead US ‘super league’ dominating Europe

title: Altor-Backed Aira Raises €150 million for Heat Pump Expansion
summary: Swedish residential heating startup Aira Group AB raised €150 million ($174 million) in new funding from existing investors including the financier Harald Mix.

title: Switzerland’s Tariff Shock Is Seen Barely Hurting Growth for Now
summary: Switzerland’s economy will prove resilient enough to largely shake off the shock of US tariffs over the next year or so, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.
fullContent: Switzerland’s economy will prove resilient enough to largely shake off the shock of US tariffs over the next year or so, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.

title: ECB Is Seen Delaying Final Rate Cut of the Cycle Until December
summary: European Central Bank officials will wait until December to deliver their next interest-rate cut in what is likely to be the final move in the cycle, a Bloomberg survey showed.
fullContent: European Central Bank officials will wait until December to deliver their next interest-rate cut in what is likely to be the final move in the cycle, a Bloomberg survey showed.

title: Bank of Spain’s Political Storm Rages On With Officials Exiting
summary: A political storm that erupted when José Luis Escrivá became Bank of Spain chief last September is still raging a year later after a series of high-profile exits under his watch.
